meanings.definition: The state of being swollen or distended.
meanings.sent1: The turgescences of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent2: The plant's turgescences indicated it had absorbed plenty of water.
meanings.sent3: The turgescences of the marshmallow made it look like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: The turgescences of the riverbanks after the rain were a sign of abundance.
meanings.sent5: The turgescences of the ripe fruit were a promise of sweetness.

meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the patient's turgescences carefully.
meanings.sent2: The turgescences of the balloon were due to overinflation.
meanings.sent3: The turgescences of the pillow made it impossible to fit in the pillowcase.
meanings.sent4: The turgescences of the clouds before a storm were a warning of heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The turgescences of the sponge showed it was ready to absorb water.

meanings.sent1: The turgescences of the river were visible after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The turgescences of the dough indicated it was ready to be baked.
meanings.sent3: The turgescences of the balloon made it float effortlessly in the air.
meanings.sent4: The turgescences of the clouds signaled an approaching thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The turgescences of the flower petals added beauty to the garden.
